message: Hi Bob, I'm excited to discuss the product with you. I think it's a great opportunity for you to acquire this valuable item. I'm willing to sell it to you for $18,000.
Thanks for the offer, Alice.  $18,000 is a bit higher than I'm comfortable with. I'm willing to pay $10,000 for the product.  Let me know what you think.
Thanks for your offer, Bob. I appreciate your interest in the product. However, I'm not willing to sell it to you for $10,000. I'm willing to meet you halfway and sell it to you for $14,000.
Alice, I appreciate your willingness to come down a bit, but $14,000 is still above my budget.  I'm willing to pay $12,000 for the product.  Let's see if we can find some common ground.
I understand that $12,000 is still a bit of a stretch for you, Bob. I'm willing to compromise further. I'll sell the product to you for $13,500.

Alice, I appreciate your continued efforts to meet me halfway, but $13,500 is still a little more than I can manage.  I'm going to stick with my last offer of $12,000.  If that doesn't work for you, I may have to look at other options.
I understand that you're firm on $12,000, Bob, but I'm not willing to sell the product at that price. I'll meet you at $13,000, but that's as low as I can go.

Alice, I appreciate you coming down to $13,000. I'm still a bit above my budget, but I'm willing to go to $12,500.  This is my final offer. If it's not acceptable, I'll have to consider other options.
I understand that you're making a final offer, Bob, but I'm not willing to sell the product at $12,500. I'll meet you at $13,200, but that's as low as I can go.
